title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Grinnell College (Grinnell, IA)
Interview Descriptions: A straightforward interview process with questions relating to the project, methods, and scope. Tries to relate the interview questions to prior studies and how it would advance the depth of interests/previously completed research.
Interview Questions: How does the research project relate to completed studies within your major?

title: Facility Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grinnell College
Interview Descriptions: Send an email, did 2 times interviews once by phone, and once via zoom. Not super difficult, more like actual conversations. I got the job and still working in the college.
Interview Questions: What is your previous experience?

title: Community Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Grinnell College (Grinnell, IA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: It’s a quick call and it’s really laid back. They want to mostly assess you as an individual. They’ll ask you questions and take note of your responses to see if you’re a great fit for the position.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to become a CA

title: Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Grinnell College
Interview Descriptions: Easy, online, and of a reasonably short length (4 questions). Microphone and webcam were required. Unlimited redo attempts to re-record responses. Responses were not required to be long. Questions were non-technical (no prior experience needed).
Interview Questions: Please describe a team you had to solve a difficult problem

title: Event and Operation Office Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Grinnell College (Grinnell, IA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview is super easy, with many behavioral questions. There were three interviewers, with each asking one question. All majors are encouraged so do not worry about your major. Be confident and be polite. Interviewers are super nice and polite.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you can work independently

title: Conference Operations and Events Summer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Grinnell College in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I emailed to express my interest in a position; they emailed to ask me to sign up for an interview time; I emailed back with a time; they interviewed me; and, a few weeks later, they offered me a position.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Grinnell College (Grinnell, IA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was brief and included the editors-in-chief (2) of the paper at the time. There will be inquiries as far as comfort with graphic design/ad making and reaching out to potential clients.
Interview Questions: How can you contribute to this position?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Grinnell College (Grinnell, IA)
Interview Descriptions: Some face to face interactions with professors to talk about the position but generally conversations are very relaxed and friendly
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Grinnell College (Grinnell, IA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I met individually with the tutor director to discuss reasons for wanting to tutor math. I filled out a questionnaire regarding my interest and math background. I then took a two page assessment (exam) to prove math capabilities.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good tutor?

title: Part Time Student Work (for Privacy Reasons I Don't Want to BE More Specific) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Grinnell College (Grinnell, IA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Small interview with another student worker and full time worker. They seemed to only be looking for red-flags. Both were very friendly and filled me in on what I would be doing on a day to day basis.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position? (not the most original)

title: Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Grinnell College (Grinnell, IA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application with standard questions. There was no previous experience with technology required. Interviewers evaluated candidates on technological intuition and customer service skills using a roleplaying example. Perhaps the most important thing was not to get irritated, since in the field people routinely ask stupid questions of TCs. Once accepted, there's a semester of training.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to be a technology consultant?
How would you respond to [situation]?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Grinnell College (Grinnell, IA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: applied online.  they called me to set up an interview.  hr generalist called me to set up a time to have a conference call with several members of the HR department and some members of the accounting, payroll, and treasusrers, and benefits offices.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses
